page.title: 09THE BIRKIN CENTRE KNUTSFORD
page.content: The Birkin Centre is owned by Macclesfield Borough Council. It comprises 5 rooms, offices, toilets and kitchen. Rooms may be hired for dances or concerts, wedding receptions and parties and cub scout meetings. The hourly fee varies between Â£1.40 and Â£16.20 depending on size of room and time of day. The Council for Voluntary Services is the main user. The C.V.S. has its office here as well as organising Day-care facilities for the elderly, twice weekly luncheon clubs for 35, weekly senior citizens friendship club with dances every month for 30 or 40,and a Bingo Club. There is a Citizens Advice Bureau two afternoons per week, a playgroup for 15-20 is held every morning and a Mother and Toddler group one afternoon per week.
